title: English Language Arts: Grade 3
subject: English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects (2024-)

document.title: Iowa Academic Standards for English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects

F5D9F9FB1D5C42E4AF1BFD07E39CA810.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate conversational, general academic, and domain-specific
words and phrases, including those that signal spatial and temporal relationships (e.g., After dinner that
night, we went looking for them).

FB3D87F19B2643EEB4FAA8A8D3DFF560.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among related words that describe states of mind or degrees of
certainty (e.g., knew, believed, suspected, heard, wondered).

E19EEE68B48C457BB18C8B6443005DB8.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., describe people who are
friendly or helpful).

5E2B49ACBC9D4E548ED54B4C2C8976C1.description: Distinguish the literal and nonliteral meanings of words and phrases in context (e.g., take steps).

3A203023C78F47EE897D367F079CEA4A.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

4F42BBFC7AB84D48A6AF895A44C5D10D.description:
Use reference materials (e.g., glossaries or beginning dictionaries) to determine or clarify the
precise meaning of key words and phrases.

2FD72D7A72B84C5CB3D48D5724A5BDB6.description:
Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g.,
company, companion).

8A4564CC1E9141E1BE95EBB938705EE1.description:
Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known affix is added to a known word
(e.g., agreeable/disagreeable, comfortable/uncomfortable, care/careless, heat/preheat).

201A7AB098804087880C60AB8D6A3A36.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

C61315123B374619AD41B066FCCF8A3F.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade
3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

6907A4251FCE4CC098803F5A31B9F59B.description:
Recognize and observe differences between the conventions of spoken and written standard
English.

AB419654D9DA49FAAACD1219527AFB4E.description: Choose words and phrases for effect.

2BE45B67373443FD8362B1C47113A42E.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

2FDAF515D67844F29134F272FE49709F.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., beginning dictionaries) as needed to check and correct
spellings.

C9EA9B391CFD43098189B58A992EC927.description:
Use spelling patterns and generalizations (e.g., word families, position-based spellings, syllable
patterns, ending rules, meaningful word parts) in writing words.

7B54479C425E4B558CC8B248112F6CC5.description:
Use conventional spelling for high-frequency and other studied words and for adding suffixes to
base words (e.g., sitting, smiled, cries, happiness).

C1575A3EA2B445DEBE46902692B9F4B9.description: Use commas and quotation marks in dialogue.

162EA7703F5E46AB92C20D858C4E62A3.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling
when writing.

F6587866E6B8403EA4BF6969FCCCDB63.description: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences.

76141453578246F89D8BEB28F4C3E554.description:
Form and use comparative and superlative adjectives and adverbs, and choose between them
depending on what is to be modified.

FE36A965E63F4445BFDEDF75683F4215.description: Form and use the simple (e.g., I walked; I walk; I will walk) verb tenses.

4878C0B058004B63B4E575881240E090.description: Form and use regular and irregular verbs.

C09C0F1610084C9A94000395665BEAF0.description: Form and use regular and irregular plural nouns.

B95AE49BD798410BBB26100BDD7203E5.description:
Explain the function of nouns, pronouns, verbs, adjectives, and adverbs in general and their
functions in particular sentences.

85D517F4EF3A41ADA67012D171839866.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or
speaking.

BA7263F4B24B4C05B1D8264F627C69C4.description:
Speak audibly and in complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation, such as when
performing dramatic readings or presentations, in order to provide requested detail or clarification. (See
grade 3 Language standards 1 and 3 for specific expectations.)

C51D1BF232754EA3882C4E713CFEE5FA.description:
Create engaging audio recordings of stories or poems that demonstrate fluid reading at an
understandable pace; add visual displays when appropriate to emphasize or enhance certain facts or
details.

9678346DED29419B86443492C072B7F6.description:
Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant,
descriptive details, speaking clearly at an understandable pace.

2F0C899C1EEF4DDCBDB5D9D1A8CBF271.description:
Ask and answer questions about information from a speaker, offering appropriate elaboration and
detail.

0B8B2D319FF84CC186A25D13266D94C4.description:
Determine the main ideas and supporting details of a text read aloud or information presented in
diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

94E5F90382AD42AF8198A7F5CCBCF307.description: Explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.

22E05A2459C646CAAEAF647BF67BC882.description:
Ask relevant and clarifying questions of information presented, stay on topic, and link their own
ideas and understanding to the remarks of others.

88659CAC89024621B5CC20A1F5D230CF.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening to
others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

8E9F8431AA07484BACD3A2BFF4CB4DB3.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that
preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.

16CEEE6EBFA54993B69455F7424EC170.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with
diverse partners on grade 3 topics and texts, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

BF86259904334D2BAC3BBEC437382459.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time
frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and
audiences.

37C2EAEAAA0C44D79DC6CEA4D41C5AFB.description:
Recall information from experiences or gather information from print and digital sources; take brief
notes on sources and sort evidence into provided categories.

B7B4B30BAEBE4A539073810C7156C6D9.description: Conduct short research projects that build knowledge about a topic.

19FF6878CB2B4F45A38AEACFAA565EB4.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

84843A849D114BF9864E58EF3C954EA1.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce and publish writing (using
keyboarding skills) as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

49C0646BAB734F7EA2F07F47B93E376B.description:
With scaffolding and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by
planning, revising, and editing. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language
standards 1–3 up to and including grade 3.)

96BB9FCB691F4D6CA0A7D440E304ED7C.description:
With guidance and support from adults, produce writing in which the development and organization are
appropriate to task and purpose. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards
1–3 above.)

7ACAF2975A9C4A07A340C428CB3A61FA.description: Use temporal words and phrases to signal event order.

1B42C77DDF3F468B85A542682AF1E777.description:
Use dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings to develop experiences and
events or show the response of characters to situations.

6B10DD4CD8E743558125879098F835EF.description:
Use an organizational structure to establish a situation and introduce a narrator and/or
characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

58350C48E35B445E9732E7E5E05EF39C.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique,
descriptive details, and clear event sequences.

C00933DF97934603B7009D84AE2FB9CF.description: Provide a concluding statement or section.

0DAF44602C5F42719F167F83F47957B3.description:
Use linking words and phrases (e.g., also, another, and, more, but) to connect ideas within
categories of information.

C75529B2DF5E4D38B90DB42A4A323DA4.description: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, and details.

BBF4EF652D344EEE8745B15BDB88C683.description:
Introduce a topic and group related information together; include illustrations when useful to
aiding comprehension.

3AF4ACF8217F44BDBA5B5628AD7CF4C3.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.

42BF57B89EDF4AE4AE3CA500817A7640.description: Provide a concluding statement or section.

FB43F5E144314E82BF537FDD99BFD7CF.description:
Use linking words and phrases (e.g., because, therefore, since, for example) to connect opinion
and reasons.

C808A218C8D6426F8D1A997220FEF557.description: Provide reasons that support the opinion.

4C4D66A111FF4812B9D5B039B46B1B0A.description:
Introduce the topic or text they are writing about, state an opinion, and create an organizational
structure that lists reasons.

CEEA1AD1AF754DC9B1394CA3F6D9388F.description: Write opinion pieces, supporting a point of view with reasons.

C80D43D7B6464FEF984859D848291850.description: Produce cursive writing with accuracy and automaticity.

DD83C20C2FB043EE8E207A4404D8858C.description: Form all upper and lowercase cursive letters efficiently and proportionately.

DC2BB444BE3A4E3EB598398A5F7A0022.description: Write legibly for a variety of tasks and purposes.

4702991B07A24C3CA3ECB2153E8DD468.description:
Read grade-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on
successive readings.

FB6CA111D142440F9B4EB9022256DA12.description: Use decoding skills to self-correct word recognition, rereading as necessary.

1AC67B0AE27440F3A42CCEFC834F69CF.description: Read grade level text with purpose and understanding.

AF3877B7B60E450586AD3A5680AE62E4.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

79D05FB733C942F5862F2901207BD836.description: Read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words with accuracy and automaticity.

970C064CE39D4ED3A9F850A5BB2F1CAD.description: Decode and encode words with common Latin suffixes.

A78827384D2A4118BCCC01AB6A5C3B73.description: Identify and know the meaning of the most common prefixes and derivational suffixes.

4BD4CF1957E842D9BE7AA08AB08BE733.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to support decoding and encoding words.

F07656B6D7D54659A62A8F4B33F92B41.description: Reading and Writing Standards: Foundational Skills

9DBDD34ABE15460A8D450495FF0F6106.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies,
science, and technical texts, at the high end of the grades 2–3 text complexity band independently and
proficiently.

369B1710722A4C44BF67DC46D31073DE.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

BF9A654F0A2146D4B60FDBF0296B90A8.description:
Compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two texts on the same
topic.

D87B6C90E5324A76832F8A728EB93E66.description:
Describe the logical connection between particular sentences and paragraphs in a text (e.g.,
comparison, cause/effect, first/second/third in a sequence).

622FF139798C4DA5AD708C79630264E6.description:
Use information gained from illustrations (e.g., maps, photographs) and the words in a text to
demonstrate understanding of the text (e.g., where, when, why, and how key events occur).

B7B8B0CD92C541F4BF9E5674024D7D7F.description: Compare and contrast their own point of view and/or perspective from that of the author of a text.

5985C33912A043EC8A7EFA9BD5FF4C3B.description:
Use text features and search tools (e.g., key words, sidebars, hyperlinks) to locate information relevant
to a given topic efficiently.

23F61AB6344A45959966481D598B2706.description:
Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant
to a grade 3 topic or subject area.

7D25AEC9FA2A45CFBDE32D14E7194E8C.description:
Describe the relationship between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in
technical procedures in a text, using language that pertains to time, sequence, and cause/effect.

37DC04C7E0D54EE89DD70C78152A0C78.description: Determine the main idea of a text; recount the key details and explain how they support the main idea.

FB45863BA0D245FA998E361A886B4A6A.description:
Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the
basis for the answers.

23D938C5F2A44F1B846D449D0D38E7CC.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the
high end of the grades 2–3 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

E12F6DDA8C5E4B338CE775845F77938C.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

82B3EF7412874EEC9EF4BC222542031E.description:
Compare and contrast the settings, plots, and themes of stories written by the same author about the
same or similar characters (e.g., in books from a series).

A0E35B050A5543B4831B035B6E3504AF.description:
Explain how specific aspects of a text’s illustrations contribute to what is conveyed by the words in a
story (e.g., create mood, emphasize aspects of a character, or setting).

FEA88256BDE24D2A9811C0120A28EB24.description:
Compare and contrast their own point of view (perspective) from that of the narrator or those of the
characters.

FD9E76DD4C02416BA2308BA4AB51490E.description:
Refer to parts of stories, dramas, and poems when writing or speaking about a text, using terms such
as chapter, scene, and stanza; describe how each successive part builds on earlier sections.

62BA8E05D8034BC9BA3232B06CE2AA36.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, distinguishing literal from
nonliteral language.

F7F3B6807BB445088677F2BCE3B9F12A.description:
Describe characters in a story (e.g., their traits, motivations, or feelings) and explain how their actions
contribute to the sequence of events.

03A034250AFA425C8415482D136A379C.description:
Recount and determine the central message, lesson, or moral of fables, folktales, and myths from
diverse cultures and explain how it is conveyed through key details in the text.

9C852072EEA14B6EA1FE4CC9A2A84BDA.description:
Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the
basis for the answers.
